intro: Cyclea ochiaiana, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an attractive ornamental plant and a subject of ecological interest.
